description: Completion of 2 four-hour laboratory experiments with written accounts and interviews. Assessed on understanding of principles, experimental results quality, and lab book presentation.
Analytical or numerical problem-solving tasks based on three-dimensional systems, approximation methods, and time-dependence topics. Released between Weeks 8-10 with one week completion time.
2-hour exam during formal examination period with analytical questions covering all lecture and tutorial topics. May include diagrams or graphs.
50-minute in-class test around Week 4 assessing analytical problem-solving and conceptual understanding of early course topics.
